Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Luis E. Rivera-Ortiz (7) was on 9/4/2012. Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty Benito Rodriguez, PO Carolina Aparicio, Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez, and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to Count 1. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for trial setting. The parties were heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $10,000.00 to be secured by cash or real property. Conditions of release as recommended in the Pretrial Services Report to include drug testing. Deft shall not reside nor go near, for any reason, to the Buena Vista Ward. Order to issue once secured portion of the bail has been posted. (Court Reporter FTR) (Hearing was set for 9:00 a.m., held at 9:47-9:55 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 09/04/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment/Detention Hearing as to Luis D. Hernandez-Ubiles (11) was held on 9/4/2012. Present: SAUSA Cesar Rivera, Atty Ernesto Hernandez, PO Carolina Aparicio, Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez and Defendant. Defendant was found competent to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all applicable counts. The government has seven days to produce discovery, and the defense has 14 days after that date to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for trial setting. The parties were heard as to bail. Bail is set in the amount of $10,000.00 of which $2,500.00 shall be secured by cash or real property and the remaining balance shall be unsecured. Conditions of release as recommended in the pretrial services report. Deft shall not reside or go near, for any reason, to the Buena Vista Ward. Deft shall have one calendar week to post bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter FTR.) (Hearing was set for 10:00 a.m., held at 10:32-10:51 a.m.) (mc) (Entered: 09/04/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin:Arraignment/Detention as to Hiram Radriguez-Espinosa (2) Count 1,2 held on 9/4/2012. Present were SAUSA Cesar Rivera and Ms. Lydia Lizarribar. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to both counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for scheduling. As to bail, the Government requested detention without bail and proffered the evidence against this defendant. Ms. Lizarribar argued in favor of bail and offered conditions of release. After hearing the arguments from the parties, the Court granted the Government's motion requesting detention without bail, finding defendant to be a risk of flight and a danger to the community, and ordered him detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 02:47.Hearing ended at 03:08. Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) Modified on 10/2/2012 as to Judge held hearing (er). (Entered: 09/05/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin :Arraignment/Detention as to Omar Sierra-Hernandez (12) Count 1 held on 9/4/2012. Present were SAUSA Cesar Rivera and Mr. Juan Milanes. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to the sole count. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Gelpi for scheduling. As to bail, the Government requested detention without bail and proffered evidence against defendant. Mr. Milanes argued in favor of bail. After hearing the parties, the Court imposed bail in the amount of $10,000.00 of which $2,500.00 are to be cash or secured by property and $7,500.00 unsecured; defendant is to reside outside the Buena Vista Ward in Humacao and he's not to go near the same, plus all other conditions recommended in the PT report. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 02:30.Hearing held at 02:47.Hearing ended at 03:16.Interpreter -Hilda Gutierrez. (yr) Modified on 10/2/2012 as to Judge held hearing(er). (Entered: 09/05/2012)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi: Status Conference as to David Hernandez-Lopez, et al., held on 9/26/2012. The government requested additional time to provide discovery in this case due to technical difficulties. Government also informed the Court that an evidence inspection is pending. Request is granted. The government by 10/9/12 shall designate several dates to hold the evidence inspection. The Court made a finding that the Speedy Trial remains tolled in the interest of Justice which outweighs the best interest of the public and the defendants under 18 U.S.C. Sec. 3161(h) (7)(A) until the next conference. Attorney Juan A. Albino objected to the tolling of the Speedy trial due to the government's difficulties. Objection is duly noted by the Court. Further Status Conference set for 12/3/2012 09:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.) Present: See attendance sheet. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. ORDER denying 436 Motion to Continue as to Hiram Radriguez-Espinosa (2): Denied. The Court will not continue the sentencing hearing post November 2014 to wait and see what the Congress, President and US Sentencing Commission may ultimately do. Accordingly, the USPO Officer need not calculate an alternate and possible future- enacted guideline scenario.The court at this time does not intend to suggest what the ultimate sentence imposed will be. In the statement of facts (docket # 379) defendant admits that he is responsible for 3.5-5 kilos of cocaine. However, this is not all. He was also a supplier who possessed firearms to protect the drug point operations. Here, thus, we are not talking about an unarmed defendant who merely participated in a low level capacity in the drug venture. While the court 1s mindful that as part of the plea agreement the 18 USC sec 924(c) count will be dismissed for sentencing purposes, such admitted conduct does not vanish into thin air accordingly. Such overall conduct as part of a plea agreement will be considered by the court at sentencing now, and even had the mandatory minimums been lowered.Signed by Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi on 2/12/14. (al) (Entered: 02/12/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Change of Plea Hearing as to Emmanuel Gonzalez-Colon (14) held on 11/25/2019: Present were AUSA Richard Passanisi and Attorney Alex Rosa-Ambert. The defendant was on bond, present in court and did not require the services of the Court Interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent to plea. The defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Gustavo A. Gelpi, U.S. District Judge so that the guilty plea as to count one (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing is set for 3/24/2020 at 9:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi. Attorney Rosa- Ambert requested that the defendant remain under the same conditions of release. The Government had no objections. The defendant shall remain under the same conditions of release pending Sentencing Hearing. (Court Reporter DCR / Courtroom 8.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 09:47. Hearing ended at 10:06. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jose Soto-Rosado (21) held on 11/30/2020 via VTC. Present were AUSA Scott Anderson, AFPD Eleonora Marranzini, SUSPO Martin De Santiago and USPO Claudia Miranda. The defendant was present by video and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically at the hearing and consented to proceed by way of VTC. Defense counsel stated that they would not challenge the violations alleged in the 934 Motion filed by USPO and that a preliminary hearing would not be necessary if permitted to argue in favor of conditions of release. The Court granted the request. Defense counsel argued in favor of the defendants release to permit him to continue with treatment and be able to work. The Government moved for detention. After hearing the parties, the Court ordered the defendant to be released under the same conditions of supervised release previously imposed with the added condition of inpatient drug treatment to be coordinated and arranged by USPO. The defendant shall be released directly from MDC Guaynabo into the inpatient treatment program. (Court Reporter Evilys Carrion.) Hearing set for 11:00. Hearing held at 11:34. Hearing ended at 11:45. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (rom) (Entered: 11/30/2020)
